summary: This document is a series of emails from August 2020 between law enforcement personnel, discussing efforts to interview and subpoena three individuals in connection with the Epstein/Maxwell investigation. It details attempts to contact a witness, coordination with an attorney, and the issuance of subpoenas for individuals believed to have connections to Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Detective Byrne
persons.role: NYPD / FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force detective
persons.context: The primary author of the emails, coordinating subpoena efforts and witness interviews for the investigation.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned as someone a witness was recently in communications with, and a central figure in the case.

connections.description: Byrne is investigating Maxwell and seeking witnesses connected to her.

events.title: Subpoena Authorization Request
events.description: Detective Byrne requests subpoenas for three individuals believed to have connections to Ghislaine Maxwell, as they are not in New York and attempts to contact one have failed.

events.title: Witness Interview Scheduling
events.description: An update is provided that a witness, through her attorney, is eager to talk and a mid-afternoon call is proposed for an interview.

keyFacts: Law enforcement was actively seeking to subpoena and interview at least three individuals in connection with the Ghislaine Maxwell investigation in July/August 2020.
One witness had made multiple unsuccessful attempts to contact another individual (who shares a name with a known victim) and had recently been in communication with Ghislaine Maxwell.
Subpoenas were issued on July 24, 2020, for three individuals, indicating a formal legal process to compel testimony or evidence.
The emails show coordination between the NYPD/FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force and federal prosecutors in pursuing leads.
A witness expressed eagerness to speak with investigators, with scheduling around child care needs.
